definition: a hundred flowers bloom, a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC, but adopted for Mao's campaign of 1956
pinyin: bai3 hua1 qi2 fang4 , bai3 jia1 zheng1 ming2

definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
